intro: Pedicularis flava var. conica, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic growth habit and lack of chlorophyll. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its conical inflorescence and hairy stems are distinctive botanical features. It thrives in rocky, alpine environments and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
